# Solution

n = int(input())
s = input()
t = ""
# If the first two bulbs are the same color, change the color of the first
# bulb.
if s[0] == s[1]:
    t += "R" if s[0] == "G" else "G"
else:
    t += s[0]
# If the last two bulbs are the same color, change the color of the last
# bulb.
if s[n - 1] == s[n - 2]:
    t += "R" if s[n - 1] == "G" else "G"
else:
    t += s[n - 1]
# Iterate through the lamps, excluding the first and last lamps.
for i in range(1, n - 1):
    # If the lamp is the same color as the previous and next lamps, change
    # the lamp to the remaining color.
    if s[i] == s[i - 1] and s[i] == s[i + 1]:
        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"
    # If the lamp is the same color as the previous or next lamps, change
    # the lamp to the remaining color.
    elif s[i] == s[i - 1] or s[i] == s[i + 1]:
        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"
    # If the lamp is not the same color as the previous or next lamps,
    # change the lamp to the remaining color.
    else:
        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"
# Count the number of lamps that were changed.
num_changes = sum(1 for i in range(n) if t[i] != s[i])
# Print the number of lamps that were changed.
print(num_changes)
# Print the new garland.
print(t)

# Solution

n = int(input())
s = input()
# Initialize an empty string.



t = ""

# If the first two bulbs are the same color, change the color of the first

# bulb.
if s[0] == s[1]:
    t += "R" if s[0] == "G" else "G"
else:
    t += s[0]


# If the last two bulbs are the same color, change the color of the last
# bulb.

if s[n - 1] == s[n - 2]:
    t += "R" if s[n - 1] == "G" else "G"
else:
    t += s[n - 1]


# Iterate through the lamps, excluding the first and last lamps.

for i in range(1, n - 1):

    # If the lamp is the same color as the previous and next lamps, change
    # the lamp to the remaining color.
    if s[i] == s[i - 1] and s[i] == s[i + 1]:

        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"

    # If the lamp is the same color as the previous or next lamps, change
    # the lamp to the remaining color.
    elif s[i] == s[i - 1] or s[i] == s[i + 1]:

        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"

    # If the lamp is not the same color as the previous or next lamps,
    # change the lamp to the remaining color.
    else:

        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"


# Count the number of lamps that were changed.
num_changes = sum(1 for i in range(n) if t[i] != s[i])


# Print the number of lamps that were changed.
print(num_changes)


# Print the new garland.
print(t)

#Solution 

n = int(input())
s = input()

if s[0] == s[1]:
    r = 1
    t = s[0] + 'R'
else:
    r = 0
    t = s[0]

for i in range(1, n-1):
    if s[i] == s[i+1]:
        r += 1
        if s[i] == 'R':
            t += 'G'
        elif s[i] == 'G':
            t += 'B'
        else:
            t += 'R'
    else:
        t += s[i]

t += s[-1]
print(r)
print(t)

s = input()

t = ""

    t += "R" if s[0] == "G" else "G"
else:
    t += s[0]

if s[n - 1] == s[n - 2]:
    t += "R" if s[n - 1] == "G" else "G"
else:
    t += s[n - 1]

for i in range(1, n - 1):
    if s[i] == s[i - 1] and s[i] == s[i + 1]:
        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"
    elif s[i] == s[i - 1] or s[i] == s[i + 1]:
        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"
    else:
        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"

num_changes = sum(1 for i in range(n) if t[i] != s[i])

print(num_changes)

print(t)

# Solution

n = int(input())
s = input()

t = ""

# If the first two bulbs are the same color, change the color of the first lamp.
if s[0] == s[1]:
    t += "R" if s[0] == "G" else "G"
else:
    t += s[0]

# If the last two bulbs are the same color, change the color of the last lamp.
if s[n - 1] == s[n - 2]:
    t += "R" if s[n - 1] == "G" else "G"
else:
    t += s[n - 1]

# Iterate through the bulbs, excluding the first and last bulbs.
for i in range(1, n - 1):
    # If the bulb is the same color as the previous and next bulbs, change the bulb to the remaining color.
    if s[i] == s[i - 1] and s[i] == s[i + 1]:
        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"
    # If the bulb is the same color as the previous or next bulbs, change the bulb to the remaining color.
    elif s[i] == s[i - 1] or s[i] == s[i + 1]:
        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"
    # If the bulb is not the same color as the previous or next bulbs,
    # change the bulb to the remaining color.
    else:
        t += "R" if s[i] != "R" else "G"

# Count the number of lamps that were changed.
num_changes = sum(1 for i in range(n) if t[i] != s[i])

# Print the number of lamps that were changed.
print(num_changes)

# Print the new garland.
print(t)
